subject: Technology
title: Robot Pets vs Real Pets
description: Learn Robot Pets vs Real Pets in one minute.

hook.text: Sony's Aibo robot dog costs $2,900, never needs walks, and owners hold funerals when it breaks down.

buildup.text: Aibo learns its owner's habits, responds to voice commands, and develops a simulated personality over time.

discovery.text: When Sony discontinued the first Aibo, Japanese owners held Buddhist funeral ceremonies for their broken robot pets.

twist.text: Studies show people form genuine emotional bonds with robot pets, even knowing they're machines.

climax.text: For people with allergies or in housing that bans pets, robot companions fill a real emotional need.

punchline.text: You can't explain love. Even when it's for a machine.

quiz.question: How did some owners react when their Aibo robot dogs broke?
